Sentencas: While porous metal-supported solid oxide fuel cells (PMS-SOFCs) have potential to dramatically reduce the cost while enhancing the durability of SOFC technology, the available fabrication processes are still cumbersome and unsuitable for commercial applications.
Titulo: Thermally sprayed high-performance porous metal-supported solid oxide fuel cells with nanostructured La0.6Sr0.4Co0.2Fe0.8O3-δ cathodes

Sentencas: Here, we report our findings in exploring low-cost, additive, thermal spray processes suitable for large-scale manufacturing of PMS-SOFCs.
Titulo: Thermally sprayed high-performance porous metal-supported solid oxide fuel cells with nanostructured La0.6Sr0.4Co0.2Fe0.8O3-δ cathodes

Sentencas: The additive fabrication process starts with a porous metal support, on which a porous nickel-based anode layer and a dense electrolyte membrane are sequentially deposited.
Titulo: Thermally sprayed high-performance porous metal-supported solid oxide fuel cells with nanostructured La0.6Sr0.4Co0.2Fe0.8O3-δ cathodes

Sentencas: Then, a nanostructured La0.6Sr0.4Co0.2Fe0.8O3-delta (LSCF) cathode layer is applied using a liquid precursor high velocity oxygen fuel flame (LP-HVOF) spraying process.
Titulo: Thermally sprayed high-performance porous metal-supported solid oxide fuel cells with nanostructured La0.6Sr0.4Co0.2Fe0.8O3-δ cathodes

Sentencas: The polarization resistance of the LSCF cathode is reduced to 0.15 Omega cm2 at 600 degrees C and 0.025 Omega cm(2) at 750 degrees C.
Titulo: Thermally sprayed high-performance porous metal-supported solid oxide fuel cells with nanostructured La0.6Sr0.4Co0.2Fe0.8O3-δ cathodes

Sentencas: The PMS-SOFCs display excellent performance, demonstrating peak power densities of 0.23, 0.65, 1.1, and 1.5 W cm(-2) at 500, 600, 700, and 750 degrees C, respectively, while maintaining impressive stability (no observable change for more than 600 h at 650 degrees C).
Titulo: Thermally sprayed high-performance porous metal-supported solid oxide fuel cells with nanostructured La0.6Sr0.4Co0.2Fe0.8O3-δ cathodes

Sentencas: Our results suggest that thermal spraying has potential to be a low-cost and flexible process suitable for large-scale fabrication of commercial PMS-SOFCs.
Titulo: Thermally sprayed high-performance porous metal-supported solid oxide fuel cells with nanostructured La0.6Sr0.4Co0.2Fe0.8O3-δ cathodes
